justification: Participants judged how blameworthy they thought it would be if a Decider chose the more harmful option on a continuous scale ranging from 0 (extremely praiseworthy) to 100 (extremely blameworthy).

topic_or_construct: Moral decision-making about dirty vs. clean money
measured_by: Moral Decision Task (choices between money amounts and electric shocks)
justification: In the Moral Decision Task participants made a series of real decisions that involved choosing between two options differing in money and number of painful electric shocks, allowing researchers to capture moral decisions regarding accepting or rejecting dirty money.

topic_or_construct: A priori tendency to forego harming others
measured_by: Starting point parameter z of the Drift Diffusion Model
justification: The bias parameter z captures the extent to which people lean toward accepting or rejecting money before seeing specific attributes; models testing a prosocial default posit that source effects should impact this starting point parameter.
